> PUT ALL ROLE IDS OF PEOPLE YOU WANT TO: THIS DOES *NOT* GUARANTEE ACCESS TO THE COMMAND, EVERYTHING ELSE IN THIS FILE ACTS AS AN OVERRIDE TO THIS.
> IF THIS IS LEFT BLANK, NO ONE CAN ACCE: so make sure 2 add chur roles :D
> If role ID is in key then users do NOT: (I.e. if a permission is clear that means everyone who can use these commands has access).
> If a command is NOT in this list at al: Anyone in the server (including members) can use the command.
> Any role_ids put in the 'warn' key lis: the check is only done once, on the parent command. (I.e. $warn add, $warn edit,)
